text: I am Fathur Rachman Widhiantoko
the Co-Founder and CTO of meeting.ai.
We are a fast-growing startup based in Jakarta, Indonesia
that is passionate about using AI to make meetings more productive.
Since launching in early 2023,
our SaaS platform has helped over 70,000 users
across Indonesia to transcribe, summarise and extract
key insights from their meetings.
What makes our solution unique
is that we can achieve up to 97% transcription accuracy
for Bahasa Indonesia.
Our AI-powered features integrate seamlessly
with popular meeting platforms
like Google Meet, Zoom and Microsoft Teams
as well as offline meetings.
The idea for meeting.ai came from my own frustrating experiences
sitting through long meetings and wasting hours
writing up notes and to-dos afterwards.
As we dug into this problem,
we saw an opportunity to apply cutting-edge AI technology
to radically simplify this universal pain point.
Our goal was to leverage large language models
and speech recognition to fully automate
the meeting note-taking process end-to-end.
Building a robust platform that could deliver on this promise
was not an easy feat,
especially for Bahasa Indonesia
which has unique linguistic challenges.
To solve these challenges,
we designed meeting.ai as a cloud-native platform
leveraging a microservices architecture running on Amazon EKS.
This allowed us to efficiently scale
different components based on usage patterns.
Amazon EC2 G4 instances
which provide cost-effective GPU acceleration
for our AI models enable
highly accurate Bahasa Indonesia transcription
and speaker identification.
The magic ingredient that really elevated the quality of our service
was integrating the state-of-the-art
Anthropic Claude 3 large language models from Amazon Bedrock.
For 80% of our use cases,
the Claude 3 'Haiku' model met our stringent quality bar.
For specific scenarios requiring longer context,
like 1-on-1 meetings, we use the larger 'Sonnet' model.
Rolling out Claude 3 was a quick 3 week process for 2 developers,
with no changes required to our existing prompts.
Amazon Bedrock made it plug-and-play
to access this powerful AI capability.
The new meeting summary feature, powered by Claude 3,
has resulted in a 55% increase in customer satisfaction scores,
with users praising the productivity boost from automated note-taking.
The implementation has led to a 50% reduction in LLM costs,
with the Haiku model efficiently handling most needs.
Additionally, Claude 3's larger context sizes
have enabled a 12x speed improvement,
allowing for full summaries of 2-hour discussions with a single API call.
AWS has supported us beyond just technology.
The AWS Activate program has been crucial to our growth,
providing valuable credits
that allows us to experiment and scale
without worrying about initial costs.
Their technical support and guidance
have been invaluable in optimizing our infrastructure.
Looking ahead,
we're excited to continue working with AWS.
With Amazon Bedrock and Anthropic Claude 3,
we're well-positioned to make every meeting valuable
and establish meeting.ai as the leading productivity platform
in ASEAN and beyond.
